data.title: Wonderful time!
data.text: The Cove was clean, the personnel was friendly and I felt safe having my grandchildren there. It does get really crowded, although there is lots of room! Don't let the parking lot fool you!!!

data.title: Lazy river!
data.text: Lazy river with tubes. Big slides. Decent price for admission. Did get crowded later in the afternoon. Did not eat there so can't rate the food.

data.title: Way overpriced!
data.text: I live in this city, and the "waterpark" has to be one of the worst ideas this city ever came up with.  There are a few slides, a small lazy river, a kids area, and a small swimming area.  I definitely wouldn't recommend it.  I'd recommend Vinton pool over this anyday.

data.title: Fun Family Place
data.text: Fun place to take kids. There's a lazy river to tube around, a toddler pool area, big slides, concessions, clean dressing rooms and bathrooms. Lifeguards on duty b

data.title: Disapointed
data.text: Every time we go to the pool it's at least $40. for 2 adults and 3 kids. Can't afford snack bar after entry fee. The water is always cold! And they don't have any specifics for adults.

data.title: Not the best, but best in the area
data.text: This is the best pool in the area, but compared to other cities is overpriced & closes early.  We always went on family night, tickets are cheaper then.  Also on Family Night they are open till 8 pm, normally they close at 6 pm.  How can most people get home from work & get to the pool when they close at 6 pm? Ridiculous.

data.title: Relaxation time
data.text: I love to come here and relax on the lazy river the crowd doesn't really bug me.. If you go in the morning the earliest there's not as many people. If you don't like the crowd. It's clean. Not a bad price. I come here on my days off and really enjoy myself with a family member or friend:)

data.title: Too small
data.text:
When this place first opened it was a nice change from the previous pool, but now it's way over crowded and the lazy river is just not worth the hassle. 
The kiddie area is nice, but some mothers don't watch their kids and they run around knocking the younger ones down. Family day is the worst day to go, far too many people.

data.title: Water walking
data.text:
I love the lazy river here but my favorite thing to do is the water walking from 6p tp 7:45p  as well as the early morning 
This is a great stress reliever for any adult suprising how quickly 2hours flies and you are getting good exercise

data.title: Not enough space
data.text: When this place first opened it was great. But it's not nearly big enough for everyone to enjoy it comfortably. The lazy river, my favorite part, sometimes doesn't move because there are too many people in there. They close very early as well.

data.title: Crowds an issue here
data.text: While we love the lazy river here and the slide, it's always way over crowded. The staff is nice and listen to your concerns. Most days you can't move an inch either way without touching someone. Last time we were there we moved one direction to avoid getting landed on by a kid jumping in and almost got landed on by someone else!

data.title: Small Waterpark
data.text: This is a small Waterpark in Lafayette. Open 7 days a week in the summer if the weather is appropriate. There is a large water slide two small water slides a lazy river and a small Lilly pad course. The price is reasonable and much better than Buckner Bay the indoor water park. There is also a concession stand on site with reasonable prices. I recommend this facility.
